title: [SOLVED]820-2936-b - corrupted SPI chip
message:
just receive a clean board, no visable liquid damage. 

its power onto a black screen with backlight. no folder and no chime.
all power rails are present,
one beep if no ram is installed.

so I swap the SPI chip and replaced one from a donor. now it chimes, can boot to OSX. 



how do I fix it and should i use the same rom chip when restore??

here is the SPI rom file that I dump from the original chip:

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B68B-h1FaW-oTk1zN0FUS3FiNkk/view?usp=sharing[/url]

title: [SOLVED]820-2936-b - corrupted SPI chip
message: where can i learn this? is it same as removing a lock code, like copying ME region to a good spi rom?

title: [SOLVED]820-2936-b - corrupted SPI chip
message:
Copied your ME region 0x0 to 0x180000 to a known good file and copied your override file with serial number info at 0x6fa000 to 0x6fc000.
No idea where you learn this. Use goole and start experimenting. No one told me how to do this.....

message:
the file didn't work. do I need to perform a pram reset, i've tried two chips. 

let me have a go at it.

title: [SOLVED]820-2936-b - corrupted SPI chip
message:
it's working, serial no. was unavailable. then i used Blank Board Serializer.


passed all ASD test.

thank you Duke :)
